question.body: Which of the following pressures will assist in keeping the lungs slightly inflated and ensure that they do not collapse during exhalation?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Atmospheric pressure at sea level is 1 atm. This pressure is going to determining the ease at which air will flow into the lungs.
Incorrect. The alveolar pressure fluctuates from above 1 atm to below 1 atm depending on which stage of ventilation is occurring. This is going to allow air to enter or exit the body.
Correct. Intrapulmonary pressure is the pressure within the pleural space and will be slightly less than the pressure in the alveoli to prevent the lungs from collapsing.
Incorrect. Transpulmonary pressure plays a role in creating the air pressure gradient that will allow of the exchange of gasses.
